title: As a Tester, I want to access the MJC API through the ebis link interface
custom_preconds: GIVEN a tester is logged in using an account with correct API credential
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "EBIS Link" screen from left nav
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a UI to select the MJC API, and to supply input parameters
AND user should also see the returned API response in a readable JSON format (with indents)
AND UI should have a basic Expand and collapse feature

title: As a Club, I want Minor League Compensation returned through the MJC API
custom_preconds:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Major+League+Contracts#ClubFeedRequirements:MajorLeagueContracts-5.IncludethefollowingfieldsfromtheMinorLeagueCompensationsection:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with correct API role to be able to run MJC API
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "EBIS Link" screen from left nav
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to query by PlayerID
AND user should be able to query by ContractID
AND user should be able to query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
AND fields listed on the linked wiki under Minor League Compensation section should be added to the API
AND data in the response must exactly match data on the UI in the Minor League Compensation section
AND response should be returned under 2 seconds

title: As a Club, I want General Information returned through the MJC API
custom_preconds:
**DATE RANGE INPUT FORMAT: "fromDate=2017-01-01&toDate=2017-01-02"**
GIVEN the user wants General Information returned through the MJC API
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Ebis Link under Utilities
custom_expected:
THEN then user Will be able to query by PlayerID
AND Will be able to query by ContractID
AND Will be able to query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
AND Fields listed on the linked wiki under General Information section should be added to the API
AND Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI in the General Information section
AND Response should be returned under 2 seconds
AND Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a User, I want to see the correct population of contracts returned in the MJC API
custom_preconds:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Major+League+Contracts
GIVEN a club user is logged in with correct API role to be able to run MJC API
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to "EBIS Link" screen from left nav
AND user runs a query by PlayerID
OR user runs a query by ContractID
OR user runs a query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
custom_expected: THEN the population of contracts should match the feed characteristics of the attached document
